questions.question_text:
Match List - I with List - II.

    List - II (Bond order)
  


  
    (a)
    $$N{e_2}$$
    (i)
    1

    $${N_2}$$
    (ii)
    2
  
  
    (c)
    $${F_2}$$
    (iii)
    0

    $${O_2}$$
    (iv)
    3

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
A. Phenyl methanamine

B. N,N-Dimethylaniline

C. N-Methyl aniline

D. Benzenamine

Choose the correct order of basic nature of the above amines.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements : one is labelled as Assertion A and the other is labelled as Reason R.

Assertion A : In TlI3, isomorphous to CsI3, the metal is present in +1 oxidation state.

Reason R : Tl metal has fourteen f electrons in its electronic configuration.

In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below :

option_texts.A: A is correct but R is not correct
option_texts.B: A is not correct but R is correct
option_texts.C: Both A and R are correct but R is NOT the correct explanation of A
option_texts.D: Both A and R are correct and R is the correct explanation of A

    List - I

    Sucrose

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: Seliwanoff test and Xanthoproteic test are used for the identification of ___________ and ________ respectively.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: When 12.2 g of benzoic acid is dissolved in 100 g of water, the freezing point of solution was found to be $$-$$0.93$$^\circ$$C (Kf(H2O) = 1.86 K kg mol$$-$$1). The number (n) of benzoic acid molecules associated (assuming 100% association) is ___________.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
If the activation energy of a reaction is 80.9 kJ mol$$-$$1, the fraction of molecules at 700 K, having enough energy to react to form 
products is e$$-$$x. The value of x is __________. (Rounded off to the nearest integer) [Use R = 8.31 J K$$-$$1 mol$$-$$1]

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: In mildly alkaline medium, thiosulphate ion is oxidized by $$MnO_4^ - $$ to "A". The oxidation state of sulphur in "A" is __________.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
The average S-F bond energy in kJ mol$$-$$1 of SF6 is _____________. (Rounded off to the nearest integer)

[Given : The values of standard enthalpy of formation of SF6(g), S(g) and F(g) are - 1100, 275 and 80 kJ mol$$-$$1 respectively.]

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
Emf of the following cell at 298K in V is x $$\times$$ 10$$-$$2.

Zn|Zn2+(0.1 M)||Ag+ (0.01 M)|Ag

The value of x is _________. (Rounded off to the nearest integer)

[Given : $$E_{Z{n^{2 + }}/Zn}^\theta  =  - 0.76V;E_{A{g^{2 + }}/Ag}^\theta  =  + 0.80V;{{2.303RT} \over F} = 0.059$$]

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: The pH of ammonium phosphate solution, if pka of phosphoric acid and pkb of ammonium hydroxide are 5.23 and 4.75 respectively, is ___________.

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text: The number of stereoisomers possible for [Co(ox)2(Br)(NH3)]2$$-$$ is ___________. [ox = oxalate]

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
A ball weighing 10 g is moving with a velocity of 90 ms$$-$$1. If the uncertainty in its velocity is 5%, then the uncertainty in its position is ___________ $$\times$$ 10$$-$$33 m. (Rounded off to the nearest integer)

[Given : h = 6.63 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$34 Js]

questions.subject: Chemistry
questions.question_text:
The NaNO3 weighed out to make 50 mL of an aqueous solution containing 70.0 mg Na+ per mL is _________ g. (Rounded off to the nearest integer)

[Given : Atomic weight in g mol$$-$$1 - Na : 23; N : 14; O : 16]

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
Let f(x) be a differentiable function at x = a with f'(a) = 2 and f(a) = 4. 

Then $$\mathop {\lim }\limits_{x \to a} {{xf(a) - af(x)} \over {x - a}}$$ equals :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
Let A(1, 4) and B(1, $$-$$5) be two points. Let P be a point on the circle 
(x $$-$$ 1)2 + (y $$-$$ 1)2 = 1 such that (PA)2 + (PB)2 have maximum value, then the points, P, A and B lie on :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
Consider the following system of equations :

x + 2y $$-$$ 3z = a

2x + 6y $$-$$ 11z = b

x $$-$$ 2y + 7z = c,

where a, b and c are real constants. Then the system of equations :

option_texts.A: has no solution for all a, b and c
option_texts.B: has a unique solution when 5a = 2b + c
option_texts.C: has infinite number of solutions when 5a = 2b + c
option_texts.D: has a unique solution for all a, b and c

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
A natural number has prime factorization given by n = 2x3y5z, where y and z are such 
that y + z = 5 and y$$-$$1 + z$$-$$1 = $${5 \over 6}$$, y > z. Then the number of odd divisions of n, including 1, is :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
If 0 < a, b < 1, and tan$$-$$1a + tan$$-$$1b = $${\pi  \over 4}$$, then the value of 

$$(a + b) - \left( {{{{a^2} + {b^2}} \over 2}} \right) + \left( {{{{a^3} + {b^3}} \over 3}} \right) - \left( {{{{a^4} + {b^4}} \over 4}} \right) + .....$$ is :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let $$f(x) = \int\limits_0^x {{e^t}f(t)dt + {e^x}} $$ be a differentiable function for all x$$\in$$R. Then f(x) equals :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: For x > 0, if $$f(x) = \int\limits_1^x {{{{{\log }_e}t} \over {(1 + t)}}dt} $$, then $$f(e) + f\left( {{1 \over e}} \right)$$ is equal to :

Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let A1 be the area of the region bounded by the curves y = sinx, y = cosx and y-axis in the first quadrant. Also, let A2 be the area of the region bounded by the curves y = sinx, y = cosx, x-axis and x = $${\pi  \over 2}$$ in the first quadrant. Then,

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let $$f(x) = {\sin ^{ - 1}}x$$ and $$g(x) = {{{x^2} - x - 2} \over {2{x^2} - x - 6}}$$. If $$g(2) = \mathop {\lim }\limits_{x \to 2} g(x)$$, then the domain of the function fog is :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
Let f : R $$ \to $$ R be defined as 

$$f(x) = \left\{ \matrix{
  2\sin \left( { - {{\pi x} \over 2}} \right),if\,x <  - 1 \hfill \cr 
  |a{x^2} + x + b|,\,if - 1 \le x \le 1 \hfill \cr 
  \sin (\pi x),\,if\,x > 1 \hfill \cr}  \right.$$ If f(x) is continuous on R, then a + b equals :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: If the locus of the mid-point of the line segment from the point (3, 2) to a point on the circle, x2 + y2 = 1 is a circle of radius r, then r is equal to :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: If vectors $$\overrightarrow {{a_1}}  = x\widehat i - \widehat j + \widehat k$$ and $$\overrightarrow {{a_2}}  = \widehat i + y\widehat j + z\widehat k$$ are collinear, then a possible unit vector parallel to the vector $$x\widehat i + y\widehat j + z\widehat k$$ is :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: A seven digit number is formed using digits 3, 3, 4, 4, 4, 5, 5. The probability, that number so formed is divisible by 2, is :

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text: The total number of 4-digit numbers whose greatest common divisor with 18 is 3, is _________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
Mathematics
questions.question_text: Let $$\alpha$$ and $$\beta$$ be two real numbers such that $$\alpha$$ + $$\beta$$ = 1 and $$\alpha$$$$\beta$$ = $$-$$1. Let pn = ($$\alpha$$)n + ($$\beta$$)n, pn$$-$$1 = 11 and pn+1 = 29 for some integer n $$ \ge $$ 1. Then, the value of p$$_n^2$$ is ___________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
Let z be those complex numbers which satisfy

| z + 5 | $$ \le $$ 4 and z(1 + i) + $$\overline z $$(1 $$-$$ i) $$ \ge $$ $$-$$10, i = $$\sqrt { - 1} $$.

If the maximum value of | z + 1 |2 is $$\alpha$$ + $$\beta$$$$\sqrt 2 $$, then the value of ($$\alpha$$ + $$\beta$$) is ____________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
If the arithmetic mean and geometric mean of the pth and qth terms of the 
sequence $$-$$16, 8, $$-$$4, 2, ...... satisfy the equation
 4x2 $$-$$ 9x + 5 = 0, then p + q is equal to __________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
If $${I_{m,n}} = \int\limits_0^1 {{x^{m - 1}}{{(1 - x)}^{n - 1}}dx} $$, for m, $$n \ge 1$$, and 
$$\int\limits_0^1 {{{{x^{m - 1}} + {x^{n - 1}}} \over {{{(1 + x)}^{m + 1}}}}} dx = \alpha {I_{m,n}}\alpha  \in R$$, then $$\alpha$$ equals ___________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
Let X1, X2, ......., X18 be eighteen observations such 
that $$\sum\limits_{i = 1}^{18} {({X_i} - } \alpha ) = 36$$ and $$\sum\limits_{i = 1}^{18} {({X_i} - } \beta {)^2} = 90$$, where $$\alpha$$ and $$\beta$$ are distinct real numbers. If the standard deviation of these observations is 1, then the value of | $$\alpha$$ $$-$$ $$\beta$$ | is ____________.

questions.subject: Mathematics
questions.question_text:
Let a be an integer such that all the real roots of the polynomial 
2x5 + 5x4 + 10x3 + 10x2 + 10x + 10 lie in the interval (a, a + 1). Then, |a| is equal to ___________.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Draw the output signal Y in the given combination of gates.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: An aeroplane, with its wings spread 10 m, is flying at a speed of 180 km/h in a horizontal direction. The total intensity of earth's field at that part is 2.5 $$\times$$ 10$$-$$4 Wb/m2 and the angle of dip is 60$$^\circ$$. The emf induced between the tips of the plane wings will be __________.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Find the peak current and resonant frequency of the following circuit (as shown in figure).

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A scooter accelerates from rest for time t1 at constant rate a1 and then retards at constant rate a2 for time t2 and comes to rest. The correct value of $${{{t_1}} \over {{t_2}}}$$ wil be :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements: 

Statement I : An electric dipole is placed at the center of a hollow sphere. The flux of the electric field through the sphere is zero but the electric field is not zero anywhere in the sphere.

Statement II : If R is the radius of a solid metallic sphere and Q be the total charge on it. The electric field at any point on the spherical surface of radius r (

option_texts.A: Both Statement I and Statement II are true
option_texts.B: Statement I is false but Statement II is true
option_texts.C: Statement I is true but Statement II is false
option_texts.D: Both Statement I and Statement II are false

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: If 'C' and 'V' represent capacity and voltage respectively then what are the dimensions of $$\lambda$$ where C/V = $$\lambda$$ ?

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The recoil speed of a hydrogen atom after it emits a photon in going from n = 5 state to n = 1 state will be :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A wire of 1$$\Omega$$ has a length of 1 m. It is stretched till its length increases by 25%. The percentage change in resistance to the nearest integer is :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The incident ray, reflected ray and the outward drawn normal are denoted by the unit vectors $$\overrightarrow a $$, $$\overrightarrow b $$ and $$\overrightarrow c $$ respectively. Then choose the correct relation for these vectors.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The internal energy (U), pressure (P) and volume (V) of an ideal gas are related as U $$=$$ 3PV + 4. The gas is :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The length of metallic wire is l1 when tension in it is T1. It is l2 when the tension is T2. The original length of the wire will be :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The trajectory of a projectile in a vertical plane is y = $$\alpha$$x $$-$$ $$\beta$$x2, where $$\alpha$$ and $$\beta$$ are constants and x & y are respectively the horizontal and vertical distances of the projectile from the point of projection. The angle of projection $$\theta$$ and the maximum height attained H are respectively given by :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements : one is labeled as Assertion A and the other is labeled as Reason R.

Assertion A : For a simple microscope, the angular size of the object equals the angular size of the image.

Reason R : Magnification is achieved as the small object can be kept much closer to the eye than 25 cm and hence it subtends a large angle.

In the light of the above statements, choose the most appropriate answer from the options given below :

option_texts.A: A is true but R is false
option_texts.B: A is false but R is true
option_texts.C: Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A
option_texts.D: Both A and R are true but R is NOT the correct explanation of A

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
An inclined plane making an angle of 30$$^\circ$$ with the horizontal is placed in a uniform horizontal electric field $$200{N \over C}$$ as shown in the figure. A body of mass 1 kg and charge 5 mC is allowed to slide down from rest at a height of 1 m. If the coefficient of friction is 0.2, find the time taken by the body to reach the bottom.

[g = 9.8 m/s2; $$\sin 30^\circ  = {1 \over 2}$$; $$\cos 30^\circ  = {{\sqrt 3 } \over 2}$$]

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Two masses A and B, each of mass M are fixed together by a massless spring. A force acts on the mass B as shown in the figure. If the mass A starts moving away from mass B with acceleration 'a', then the acceleration of mass B will be :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A cord is wound round the circumference of wheel of radius r. The axis of the wheel is horizontal and the moment of inertia about it is I. A weight mg is attached to the cord at the end. The weight falls from rest. After falling through a distance 'h', the square of angular velocity of wheel will be :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A particle executes S.H.M., the graph of velocity as a function of displacement is :

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A tuning fork A of unknown frequency produces 5 beats/s with a fork of known frequency 340 Hz. When fork A is filed, the beat frequency decreases to 2 beats/s. What is the frequency of fork A?

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text:
Given below are two statements :

Statement I : A second's pendulum has a time period of 1 second.

Statement II : It takes precisely one second to move between the two extreme positions.

In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below :

option_texts.A: Both Statement I and Statement II are false
option_texts.B: Statement I is false but Statement II is true
option_texts.C: Both Statement I and Statement II are true
option_texts.D: Statement I is true but Statement II is false

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: 1 mole of rigid diatomic gas performs a work of $${Q \over 5}$$ when heat Q is supplied to it. The molar heat capacity of the gas during this transformation is $${xR \over 8}$$. The value of x is _________. [R = universal gas constant]

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A particle executes S.H.M. with amplitude 'a', and time period 'T'. The displacement of the particle when its speed is half of maximum speed is $${{\sqrt x a} \over 2}$$. The value of x is __________.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Time period of a simple pendulum is T. The time taken to complete $${5 \over 8}$$ oscillations starting from mean position is $${\alpha  \over \beta }T$$. The value of $$\alpha$$ is _________.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The zener diode has a Vz = 30V. The current passing through the diode for the following circuit is ________ mA.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: The volume V of a given mass of monoatomic gas changes with temperature T according to the relation $$V = K{T^{{2 \over 3}}}$$. The workdone when temperature changes by 90K will be xR. The value of x is _________. [R = universal gas constant]

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: 27 similar drops of mercury are maintained at 10V each. All these spherical drops combine into a single big drop. The potential energy of the bigger drop is __________ times that of a smaller drop.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: A point source of light S, placed at a distance 60cm in front  of the centre of a plane mirror of width 50 cm, hangs vertically on a wall. A man walks in front of the mirror along a line parallel to the mirror at a distance 1.2 m from it (see in the figure). The distance between the extreme points where he can see the image of the light source in the mirror is __________ cm.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: In the reported figure of earth, the value of acceleration due to gravity is same at point A and C but it is smaller than that of its value at point B (surface of the earth). The value of OA : AB will be x : y. The value of x is ________.

questions.subject: Physics
questions.question_text: Two stream of photons, possessing energies equal to twice and ten times the work function of metal are incident on the metal surface successively. The value of ratio of maximum velocities of the photoelectrons emitted in the two respective cases is x : y. The value of x is ___________.
